summary: This is an arrest warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York for Ghislaine Maxwell, commanding law enforcement to arrest her. It lists the charges against her, including conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual named in the arrest warrant, accused of multiple federal crimes related to the enticement and transportation of minors and perjury.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: The issuing officer who signed the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Issuance of Arrest Warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A U.S. magistrate judge issued an arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell based on an indictment, charging her with conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.

keyFacts: An arrest warrant was issued for Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020.
The warrant was issued by U.S. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith in White Plains, New York.
Maxwell was charged with conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.
The warrant is based on an indictment filed with the court (case number 20 CR 330).
The document is a formal command to law enforcement to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell and bring her before a magistrate judge.
